intro: Lasianthus sikkimensis subsp. langkokensis, commonly known as the Sikkim lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
